name: MethodBuilder
description: A specialized builder for creating and configuring methods within generated classes.
overview:
The `ClassBuilder.MethodBuilder` class is a specialized builder for creating and configuring methods within generated classes. This builder provides a fluent API for defining method signatures, parameters, return types, method bodies, annotations, and visibility modifiers, allowing you to create comprehensive method implementations.

MethodBuilder instances are obtained through the `addMethod()` methods of ClassBuilder and support both simple code-based method creation and advanced body building with mixed Java/JavaScript execution.

methods.name: body
methods.description: Sets the method body using complete Java code. Code should include the body only (not method signature), can access parameters by name, and reference instance fields using `this.`.

methods.name: buildBody
methods.description: Creates a BodyBuilder for mixed Java/JavaScript method implementation. Useful for complex method logic with conditional execution.

methods.name: guestBody
methods.description: Sets the method body to execute JavaScript (Guest) code. The function receives parameters as an arguments array and can access `self`.

parameters.name: methodWrapper
parameters.description: JavaScript function to execute as method body

methods.name: addAnnotation
methods.description: Adds an annotation to the method.

methods.name: finish
methods.description: Finalizes the method and returns to the parent ClassBuilder. This method must be called to apply the method to the class.

methods.name: makeStatic
methods.description: Sets the method modifier to static.
examples:
const UtilityClass = Reflection.createClassBuilder("com.example.Utilities", Object)
    .addMethod(String, "formatCurrency", double)
    .makeStatic()
    .body(`
        return String.format(\"$%.2f\", amount);
    `)
    .finish()

methods.name: makePrivate
methods.description: Sets the method visibility modifier to private.
examples:
// Example from usage context (typically seen on fields, but applicable to methods in builder patterns)
.addMethod(void, "helper")
.makePrivate()
.body("...")
